title: Creating AR/VR Experiences | Ep 1: Intro to Amazon Sumerian
description:
To see all upcoming episodes and past broadcasts, visit - https://amzn.to/2rinFAm.
To learn more about Amazon Sumerian, visit https://amzn.to/2Iio8fk.
Consumers are desiring more immersive experiences, but developing such experiences can be challenging and costly. Amazon Sumerian is designed to strip away this complexity by making it easier, faster, and less expensive to develop and deploy AR, VR, and 3D applications. This tutorial provides an overview of the Sumerian interface and editor through the creation of a basic scene.

title: Amazon Sumerian - Getting Started 02: Sumerian Basics - Creating a TV Room
description: This video tutorial covers the basics of adding entities, objects, and assets to an Amazon Sumerian scene. You will learn how to place objects in a scene, adjust transform values, and customize light settings. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2kCa5ns.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian: Using the Sumerian Product Configurator
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome back Jeremiah Habets, Creative Director with Amazon Sumerian. Jeremiah will be demonstrating how to use a recently released Sumerian template, the Product Configurator. The Product Configurator is a template available to all Sumerian users that allows developers to create virtual product showcases with configuration capabilities that allows end customers to design and configure a customizable product.

Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E17 – Virtual Banking Assistant using Amazon Sumerian and Amazon Lex
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome Saira Shaik, a Sr. Tech Consultant in Bangalore, India! Saira has created a virtual banking assistant, using Sumerian Hosts. With Amazon Lex providing the chat bot capabilities, users can talk with the assistant, make payments, transfer funds, check account balances. Amazon Rekognition is used for user verification, while Amazon Translate is used to translate the Amazon Lex response to a user-selected language. This application also uses AWS Lambda, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon S3, Amazon Polly, Amazon SES, and AWS Cognito.

Learn more about Build with Amazon Sumerian: https://aws.amazon.com/sumerian/
Learn more about AWS on Twitch: https://aws.amazon.com/developer/community/live-video/
Music from Jukedeck: create your own at http://jukedeck.com

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E8 – Integrating AWS Services - Lex, Lambda, & DynamoDB
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome AWS Solutions Architect, Luis Lopez Soria, as he teaches how to integrate Amazon services into Amazon Sumerian. Viewers will learn how to create an end-to-end implementation of a voice controlled Sumerian scene with various types of entities (Host, HTML, Basic figures).

Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices.

title: Amazon Sumerian: Building a Chatbot Using A Sumerian Host and Amazon Lex
description: Amazon Sumerian allows you to use integrate Amazon Lex and Amazon Polly to create conversational Hosts. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2l55P0e.

title: Amazon Sumerian | Ep 5: Creating an Interactive Digital Signage Experience
description:
Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Rift, and HTC Vive as well as Android and iOS mobile devices. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at https://amzn.to/2srEAQMand join the Slack channel at http://slack.sumerian.world/.

In this fifth episode of the Sumerian Tutorial series, we will bring it all together to create a digital signage experience. Aiko Nakano, Design Technologist for Amazon Sumerian, shows us how to incorporate Amazon Lex and Rekognition to build a digital concierge using a chatbot and facial recognition.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E12 – Educational Escape Room
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we are excited to invite recent hackathon winner, Enrique Cachafeiro. Enrique is an educator at Duke University with a focus on VR development and training. His submission, "Room of Keys", is a VR based biology education experience that challenges users to be observant and unlock information about enzymes, then use that information to solve puzzles and challenges on the way to escaping the room. Check out the full submission: https://devpost.com/software/keys-and-locks-a-lesson-on-enzymes

title: Amazon Sumerian - Getting Started 03: Add Streaming Video
description: This video tutorial shows you how to add streaming video to an Amazon Sumerian scene. You will learn how to use the HTML3D component, embed an online streaming video, and use the State Machine to create a channel changer. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2sizTcA.

title: Introducing Amazon Sumerian Hosts
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian here - http://amzn.to/2hXqdyQ
Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, and mobile devices.

Sumerian Hosts is a feature that makes it easy to create and add animated 3D characters called Hosts. Hosts can guide your users through a scene by narrating scripts or answering questions. You can customize the Host’s characteristics such as gender, voice, and language. Using Sumerian’s integration with Amazon Lex and Amazon Polly, you can enable engaging spoken interactions between Hosts and your users. Polly lets you input text which your Host can speak in lifelike voices cross a variety of languages. Using Lex’s automatic speech recognition and natural language understanding capabilities, you can build the conversational interface for your Host that allows it to understand and respond to users’ speech. For example, you could build a trainer Host that onboards and trains new employees. When employees ask the Host questions, the Host could respond with an answer or a question requesting more information about the inquiry.

title: Amazon Sumerian: Creating AR Experiences Using Amazon Sumerian
description: With Amazon Sumerian, you can easily build augmented reality (AR) experiences. Watch as we quickly put an animated character into an AR application. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2sWKF7X.

title: Amazon Sumerian - Getting Started 01: User Interface Overview
description: This video tutorial covers the basics of the Amazon Sumerian Interface. You will learn about the various panels, menus, entity and asset libraries, and the canvas. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2sjG0xg.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Add Assets
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to add assets, both primitive entities and objects from the Asset Library. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2J6qbV4.

title: Amazon Sumerian
description:
In this session, we discuss What's New with Amazon Sumerian - sharing information on new capabilities, expanded Host options, etc. We also share how enterprises are using Sumerian to create augmented and virtual reality experiences and will showcase the web-based mobile AR experience built in collaboration with Sony Pictures Entertainment to promote the new Spiderman movie (Into the Spider-verse). To learn more, visit our webpage: https://aws.amazon.com/sumerian/ 

Catch up on the excitement of re:Invent 2018 with the AWS launchpad featuring launch announcements, demos of newly launched technology, interviews with expert guests and live Q&A. AWS re:Invent is a tech education conference for the global cloud computing community hosted by Amazon Web Services. See all recordings of the AWS Launchpad at re:Invent here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLhr1KZpdzukc0WXQruGVXTiNPtct-LLaa and learn more about AWS live streaming here: https://aws.amazon.com/twitch.

title: Developing AR/VR Experiences with Amazon Sumerian | Ep 2: Creating an Interactive Scene
description:
To see all upcoming episodes and past broadcasts, visit  - https://amzn.to/2rNdxif.
Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Rift, and HTC Vive as well as Android and iOS mobile devices.

Join us in this multi-part, interactive tutorial series to learn how to create AR and VR experiences with Amazon Sumerian. In the second session of our ten part series on developing immersive experiences with Amazon Sumerian, we will create an interactive 3D scene using primitive shapes and basic objects. We will learn how to import assets and objects, change their position within a scene, and create interactive behaviors using the State Machine. After learning these basic concepts, you will be able to start creating your own AR, VR, and mixed reality scenes and applications. Additional "Getting Started" material is available at - https://amzn.to/2IJHjz7.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E1 – Creating a Multiplayer Video Game
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. This week, we are joined by Lane Daughtry, Sr. Design Technologist for Amazon Sumerian. In this episode, we learn how we created "Bash Royale", a multiplayer video game that utilizes and integrates other services such as AWS IoT and Amazon DynamoDB.

Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E18 – Using Dynamic Content for Virtual Host Presentations
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome AWS ProServe Consultants Yuval Schaal and Tom Christensen. They will be showing how to onboard dynamic and custom content efficiently into Sumerian, and manipulate a Host's speech according to that content. This allows users to easily load their own materials into Sumerian while bypassing the Sumerian console. This demo will also be utilizing AWS Lambda, and Amazon S3.

Learn more about Build with Amazon Sumerian: https://aws.amazon.com/sumerian/

title: Amazon Sumerian - Getting Started 05: Cameras & Lights Basics
description: This video tutorial shows you the basics of both cameras and lights within Amazon Sumerian. You learn the differences between camera and light types and how to adjust their unique properties. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2L5D922.

title: Engaging Customers with Virtual Hosts Using Amazon Sumerian
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2K4M1pv.
A great customer experience implies that your brand provides an engaging and personalized experience throughout the customer journey. Are you considering a virtual host to greet customers, answer common questions and introduce your company's services and offerings? In this session, we’ll show you how Amazon Sumerian can create immersive and interactive 3D experiences by allowing you to build a scene with a Host that acts as a concierge for your customers.

Level: Intermediate

description:

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E6 – Pro Tips: Importing 3D Objects
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this stream we're joined by Cris Fudge and Jordan Pack, 3D and character artists for Amazon Sumerian, to get professional tips from 3D artists. We cover prepping objects before import, importing and converting objects, naming conventions, best practices for adding textures, discussing differences between FBX and OBJ file formats, and of course taking questions!

title: Developing AR/VR Experiences with Amazon Sumerian | Ep 6: Foundations - Customizing Your Environment
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2t19MaD.
Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices. For example, you can build a virtual classroom that lets you train new employees around the world, or you can build a virtual environment that enables people to tour a building remotely. Sumerian makes it easy to create all the building blocks needed to build highly immersive and interactive 3D experiences including adding objects (e.g. characters, furniture, and landscape), and designing, animating, and scripting environments. Sumerian does not require specialized expertise and you can design scenes directly from your browser.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian: Understanding Physically Based Rending (PBR) & Amazon Sumerian
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome back Yuan Sui, Software Development Engineer for Amazon Sumerian. Amazon Sumerian recently released the support of Physically Based Rendering (PBR) and Yuan will be here to walk us through the benefits of PBR and how to take advantage of the value it brings.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E13 – Create a Digital Asset with Sumerian & AWS IoT
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome AWS-Solutions Architect, Chris Azer, who will join us to demonstrate how to create a "digital asset" using Amazon Sumerian and AWS IoT. In this demo, we will learn how to control a physical machine using a Sumerian scene, and receive notifications based on the condition of the physical device.

title: Building AR/VR Applications on AWS
description:
Learn more about AWS at – https://amzn.to/2WlFxff 
Amazon Sumerian is a browser-based authoring tool you can use to easily create and publish augmented reality, virtual reality, and immersive applications and experiences. This service targets enterprise customers with a platform-agnostic tool that enables developers and designers to build once and deploy widely to any web-connective device, such as smartphones, VR headsets, digital signage, laptops, tablets, and smart TVs. In this session, you will learn about this session and how to start building.

title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E10 – Virtual Barista
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we are excited to invite Solutions Architects Adam Strickland and Bashar Al-fallouji from Australia. Adam and Bashar recently created an application called the "Virtual Barista", which uses a Sumerian Host to take coffee orders and delivers them to a live barista. This project was originally showcased at re:Invent 2018 and has since been demonstrated all over the world!

Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices.

description: AWS has launched Amazon Sumerian. Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. In this session, we will dive deep into details about Sumerian so you can see what's under the hood. title: Build with Amazon Sumerian | S3 E11 – Interview Simulation
description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we are excited to invite recent hackathon winners, Kirby Shabaga and Alex Porigov. Kirby, Alex, and the rest of their team submitted a hackathon project called Prosperia. Prosperia is an interactive simulator developed to practice and prepare for job interviews. It was built in mind for people returning to the workforce after time away, recent graduates, underserved populations, and anyone who wants to build confidence and competency in interviews. Created on Sumerian, Prosperia integrates with AWS Lambda, Dynamo DB, Amazon Polly, Amazon S3, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Elastic Transcoder, Amazon EC2, and Amazon RDS.

title: Developing AR/VR Experiences with Amazon Sumerian | Ep 6: Foundations - Customizing Your Environment
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2t19MaD.
Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices. For example, you can build a virtual classroom that lets you train new employees around the world, or you can build a virtual environment that enables people to tour a building remotely. Sumerian makes it easy to create all the building blocks needed to build highly immersive and interactive 3D experiences including adding objects (e.g. characters, furniture, and landscape), and designing, animating, and scripting environments. Sumerian does not require specialized expertise and you can design scenes directly from your browser.

title: Amazon Sumerian - Getting Started 04: Flying a Drone
description: This video tutorial shows you how to create an Amazon Sumerian scene where you can fly a drone using your keyboard. You will learn about the State Machine and how to add physics using the Collider and Rigid Body components. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2kzNyYw.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Add a Component
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to add a component, to an entity, from the Inspector panel. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2JvDK0H

title: AWS NY Summit - Redefining Customer Engagement with Virtual Hosts using Amazon Sumerian
description:
Learn more about the AWS Twitch Channel at https://amzn.to/2NOBwqV.
The AWS Summit was a free event designed to bring together the cloud computing community to connect, collaborate, and learn about AWS. AWS live streamed the event with the AWS Launchpad, featuring technical discussions, announcements, demos, customer interviews and live Q&A with the Twitch community.

Customizing the look, speech and clothing of a Virtual Assistant enables customers to create brand and situation specific appearances. Such customization offers a higher level of customer engagement and adds to the realism of immersive experiences. Learn how WeatherBug, Fidelity Labs, and others are creating brand-specific virtual assistants to transform their engagement and relationship with customers. To learn more about Amazon Sumerian, please visit https://aws.amazon.com/sumerian/ and to join our developer community, please join http://slack.sumerian.world/

Learn more here: https://aws.amazon.com/sumerian/ 

Host: 
- AM Grobelny, Sr. Technical Evangelist, AWS
Guests: 
- Ben Moore, Lead Product Manager, Amazon Sumerian
- Eric Johnsen, Business Development Leader, Amazon Sumerian

description: This video tutorial quickly shows you the two ways to add a camera to an Amazon Sumerian scene. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at -  https://amzn.to/2l4Owwd.

description: AWS has launched Amazon Sumerian. Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. In this session, we will introduce you to Sumerian, and how you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes for the enterprise that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, and iOS mobile devices.

description:
Join the Amazon Sumerian team as we look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. In this episode, we welcome DevPost Hackathon Winner, Mike Jones. Mike created a VR escape room experience called "Button." In this experience, users solve puzzles and challenges, always using a button, to escape from an enclosed room. This project used no scripting or coding and was built using only Sumerian provided assets!

title: WeatherBug: Virtual Weatherperson in Augmented Reality, Powered by Amazon Sumerian
description:
Learn more about AWS for Media & Entertainment at – https://amzn.to/2PL3m9N 
From the 2019 NYC M&E Symposium: Join Eddie Dingels, SVP Engineering, WeatherBug to learn about how WeatherBug is driving innovation in weather forecasting and news. Participants will see how WeatherBug is creating and delivering dynamic, real-time, micro-focused news, information, and weather stories to customers using AR. Leveraging the capabilities of Amazon Sumerian and AWS, WeatherBug is transforming the traditional weather broadcast. For example, the new WeatherBug app provides rich, visually compelling data directly to users on air quality and pollen conditions using AR. Additionally, incorporating Sumerian Hosts, WeatherBug brings the value of a local weather forecaster directly to individual customers to create an unmatched 1-1 experience. See all presentations from the Symposium in the AWS Media Blog https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/media/presentations-from-the-aws-me-nyc-symposium-on-march-20-2019/

• Eddie Dingels, WeatherBug, SVP Engineering

Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. Visit the Twitch page to learn more  - https://amzn.to/2M2cDHc.
 
With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Go, Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Google Daydream, and Lenovo Mirage as well as Android and iOS mobile devices. For example, you can build a virtual classroom that lets you train new employees around the world, or you can build a virtual environment that enables people to tour a building remotely. Sumerian makes it easy to create all the building blocks needed to build highly immersive and interactive 3D experiences including adding objects (e.g. characters, furniture, and landscape), and designing, animating, and scripting environments. Sumerian does not require specialized expertise and you can design scenes directly from your browser.

description:

Each session covered topics such as serverless computing, machine learning, augmented reality and virtual reality, containers, databases, analytics, IoT, and more. For past recordings and to see the upcoming schedule, visit https://amzn.to/2wK0GmE.

title: Amazon Sumerian - Getting Started 06: Environment Basics
description: This video tutorial shows you the basics the environment within Amazon Sumerian. You learn about the environment properties such as background, fog and ambient settings, particles, and sound. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2J1PvHU.

title: AWS re:Invent 2018: [REPEAT 1] Create Immersive Experiences Using Amazon Sumerian (ARV204-R1)
description: Anyone can create and publish augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), and 3D applications quickly and easily with Amazon Sumerian. In this session, learn how to use Sumerian to build a scene that can be published and viewed on laptops, mobile phones, VR headsets, and digital signage. Take a tour of the Sumerian interface, and learn how to build a scene, add assets and hosts, and add behaviors to create dynamically animated objects and characters in an AR/VR experience. Also see how Sumerian integrates into AWS services such as Amazon Polly, Amazon Lex, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon DynamoDB.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Toggle the Grid
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to toggle on and off the grid that appears in the editor canvas. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2JMsOLa.

title: Developing AR/VR Apps with Amazon Sumerian | Ep 4 Foundations - Creating Chatbots
description:
Amazon Sumerian lets you create and run virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring any specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. With Sumerian, you can build highly immersive and interactive scenes that run on popular hardware such as Oculus Rift, and HTC Vive as well as Android and iOS mobile devices.

Join us in this multi-part, interactive tutorial series to learn how to create AR and VR experiences with Amazon Sumerian. Catch up on past episodes and see the upcoming schedule here  - https://amzn.to/2s5Yb8M.

In this fourth episode of the Sumerian Tutorial series, we create a virtual chatbot using Amazon Lex. Amazon Lex is a service for building conversational interfaces into any application using voice and text. Amazon Lex provides the advanced deep learning functionalities of automatic speech recognition (ASR) for converting speech to text, and natural language understanding (NLU) to recognize the intent of the text, to enable you to build applications with highly engaging user experiences and lifelike conversational interactions. During this stream, we walk through how to interact with a Sumerian Host using both verbal and typed inputs and responses.

title: Amazon AI Conclave 2018 - Building an 3D Amazon Sumerian VR Bot by Atanu Roy & Girish Nair
description:
Building an 3D Amazon Sumerian VR Bot, Ripping the tech apart session by Atanu Roy, Specialist AIML Architect,Amazon and Girish Nair, Solutions Architect, Amazon

Amazon AI Conclave is an event for business leaders, data scientists, engineers and developers to learn about Amazon's machine learning services and real-world use cases developed by our customers. This program helps you understand how to build smart, customer-centric, scalable solutions in the cloud and on the edge using Amazon AI, AWS IoT, Machine Learning and AWS Deep Learning.

Check out more details about the event at https://aws.amazon.com/events/ai_conclave/

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Hide Entities
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to hide entities from view in the Amazon Sumerian canvas. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2y3x7x3.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Add an Empty Entity
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to add and use an empty entity for nesting and grouping purposes. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2sZVyG3.

title: AWS re:Invent 2018: Meet Preston, and Explore Your Digital Twin in Virtual Reality (GPSTEC321)
description: Take a journey with Preston, an Amazon Sumerian host, to diagnose and explore a 3D printed jet engine in virtual reality. Preston follows your commands to control and explore different parts of the engine. Preston can also show you the future state of your machine in virtual reality and provide recommendations by analyzing data collected from a physical jet turbine engine using IoT sensors. Learn how to build your own virtual assistant with Amazon AI services, AWS IoT services, and Amazon Sumerian virtual reality.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Duplicate Entities
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to duplicate entities inside the Entities panel. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2sNyomT.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Nest and Group Entities
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to nest, or group, entities inside the Entities panel. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2ybKlIv.

title: Using Virtual Reality to Bring Your ChatBot to Life
description:
Register for our upcoming webinars at - https://amzn.to/2NZc9Y1.
Chatbots are most commonly used as a feature of mobile or desktop websites, where text is used for the primary interaction method. In this session we’ll explore how you can use Amazon Sumerian to create a virtual host that can be interacted with through virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR) or just as a digital character. This makes voice a far more natural interaction method. We’ll also look at how you can extend this bot to interact with other rich services in the AWS Cloud.

title: Developing AR & VR Apps - Building Enterprise Applications - Virtual Tour of the Amazon Spheres
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2z05gLE.
In this series, the Amazon Sumerian team look at real-world, enterprise applications and how to build them. This week, we looked at a virtual tour that takes users inside The Spheres, located in the heart of Amazon headquarters in Seattle, WA. The Spheres house 40,000 plants from the cloud forest regions of over 30 countries. Using Amazon Sumerian, we created a visually dynamic and immersive experience that enabled users to explore The Spheres and look at annotated descriptions to learn about many rare and exotic plants. The Spheres tour experience can be viewed on a laptop, digital display, mobile device, and even a virtual reality headset. We showed you how we built this experience using readily available cameras to capture 360 degree images which were collected, edited, and stitched together to create the tour experience. In addition, we will discuss the techniques used to show you how to create similar experiences on your own!

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Undo and Redo Actions
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to undo and redo actions when editing Amazon Sumerian. Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2MjAmU9.

title: Amazon Sumerian: How to Change Entity Names
description: This video tutorial quickly shows you how to change the name of an entity as it appears in the Entities panel. Learn more at Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2sYSidV.

title: Build On AWS: The Virtual Reality Shopping Experience
description:
Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2AiITlc.
A solution based on image recognition to recognize the objects in shelves. This prototype helps in identifying products in shelves in the real time based on the Artificial intelligence based  Image Recognition, Natural Language Understanding, sensors & AR/VR AWS technologies. It helps identify when the shelves are empty, when there are products stored in wrong shelves and alerts the store manager.
For the shoppers, it can help navigate and locate products in stores, saving time and stress.

For store managers, it helps identify the shelf status. Powered by Amazon Machine Learning, to predict which product is likely to run out based on ML models trained to predict the stock levels in stores.

title: Developing AR & VR Apps | Building Enterprise Applications with ThingLogix
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2MmB41X.
In this Twitch stream, learn how to ThingLogix used Amazon Sumerian and AWS IoT to create an interactive scene using a Sumerian Host.

How to Communicate with Amazon Sumerian via AWS IoT:  https://medium.com/@samrastovich/how-to-communicate-with-amazon-sumerian-via-aws-iot-c89b3a25fd

title: Getting Started with AR and VR
description: Introduction to AR and VR using Amazon Sumerian

title: Developing AR & VR Experiences - New Features & $100,000 Hackathon Challenge
description:
Learn more about Amazon Sumerian at - https://amzn.to/2pPWA6o.
In this Twitch stream, learn about three new announcements from the Sumerian team: Integration with AWS Amplify to enable private publishing and monetization, release of a 4th Sumerian Host, and launch of a $100,000+ global AR/VR hackathon challenge.

title: Now You See It, Now You Don't: Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) in Public Sector
description:
AWS Public Sector Summit 2018 - Washington, D.C.

Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) based solutions offer a promising future in public sector, whether for enhancing citizen engagement and e-services, distance learning and simulated training, interacting with data in innovative ways, to name a few. However, building these solutions forces organizations to make hard choices on hardware and technology platforms that they can support. That is until now! Amazon Sumerian lets anyone create and run AR, VR, and 3D applications quickly and easily without requiring specialized programming or 3D graphics expertise. In this session, participants learn how to use Sumerian to build a scene that is viewable on laptops, mobile phones, VR headsets, and digital signage. We will also demonstrate how to manipulate assets and add behaviors to create dynamically animated objects and characters in an AR/VR experience. Finally, we will cover how Sumerian integrates into AWS services such as Amazon Polly, Amazon Lex, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon DynamoDB.

Speakers: Taylor Carol, Len Henry

title: AWS re:Invent 2019: Create digital twins using AWS IoT Core and Amazon Sumerian (ARV203)
description: Smart manufacturing is just the beginning. The increase in IoT devices, combined with the rise in AR/VR technology, is increasing the use of digital twins. This enables real-time data visualization through virtual representations of machines and equipment to more effectively and expertly solve real-time problems or support training applications. In this session, learn how to create a digital twin that can be deployed over the web to desktops, laptops, mobile devices, and head-mounted devices.

title: AWS re:Invent 2019: [REPEAT 1] Create augmented reality experiences with AWS (ARV204-R1)
description: Creating and delivering augmented reality (AR) experiences haven't always been easy, until now. Amazon Sumerian's browser-based authoring and publishing removes the undifferentiated heavy lifting associated with launching AR apps. You no longer need to provision AR devices, download and update SDKs, build and deploy apps for testing, configure and maintain a content distribution network, or deal with the friction of app stores. In this session, we show you how to create an AR experience with Amazon Sumerian, integrate it with other AWS services, and deliver it in minutes to users around the world via a simple browser URL.

title: AWS Summit Online ASEAN 2020 | Easily Create and Run Browser-based 3d AR Applications
description:
In this session, learn how to bring a new dimension to your web and mobile applications with Amazon Sumerian. Discover how to build 3D immersive experiences that breathe new life into the user experience on the web, increase customer engagement with brands, and improve productivity in the workplace. Discover how, through a web-based platform, your immersive experiences are accessible via a simple browser URL and can run on popular hardware for AR/VR.

AWS Speaker: Wei Shen Toh, Solutions Architect, Singapore, AWS

Download the slides: https://go.aws/2z3darp
